devdoc.author: PoolTogether Inc Team
devdoc.details: This contract supports only one prize pool ticket.This contract does not support the use of fee on transfer tokens.

params.promotionId: Id of the newly created promotion

params.amount: Amount of tokens transferred to the recipient
params.promotionId: Id of the promotion being destroyed
params.recipient: Address of the recipient that will receive the unclaimed rewards

params.amount: Amount of tokens transferred to the recipient
params.epochNumber: Epoch number at which the promotion ended
params.promotionId: Id of the promotion being ended
params.recipient: Address of the recipient that will receive the remaining rewards

params.numberOfEpochs: Number of epochs the promotion has been extended by
params.promotionId: Id of the promotion being extended

params.amount: Amount of tokens transferred to the recipient address
params.epochIds: Ids of the epochs being claimed
params.promotionId: Id of the promotion for which epoch rewards were claimed
params.user: Address of the user for which the rewards were claimed

claimRewards(address,uint256,uint8[]).details: Rewards can be claimed on behalf of a user.Rewards can only be claimed for a past epoch.

params._epochIds: Epoch ids to claim rewards for
params._promotionId: Id of the promotion to claim rewards for
params._user: Address of the user to claim rewards for

params._ticket: Prize Pool ticket address for which the promotions will be created

createPromotion(address,uint64,uint256,u.details: For sake of simplicity, `msg.sender` will be the creator of the promotion.`_latestPromotionId` starts at 0 and is incremented by 1 for each new promotion. So the first promotion will have id 1, the second 2, etc.The transaction will revert if the amount of reward tokens provided is not equal to `_tokensPerEpoch * _numberOfEpochs`. This scenario could happen if the token supplied is a fee on transfer one.

params._epochDuration: Duration of one epoch in seconds
params._numberOfEpochs: Number of epochs the promotion will last for
params._startTimestamp: Timestamp at which the promotion starts
params._token: Address of the token to be distributed
params._tokensPerEpoch: Number of tokens to be distributed per epoch

returns._0: Id of the newly created promotion

destroyPromotion(uint256,address).details: Will send back all the tokens that have not been claimed yet by users.This function will revert if the promotion is still active.This function will revert if the grace period is not over yet.

params._to: Address that will receive the remaining tokens if there are any left

endPromotion(uint256,address).details: Will only send back tokens from the epochs that have not completed.

params._to: Address that will receive the remaining tokens if there are any left

params._promotionId: Id of the promotion to extend

returns._0: True if the operation was successful

getCurrentEpochId(uint256).details: Epoch ids and their boolean values are tightly packed and stored in a uint256, so epoch id starts at 0.

params._promotionId: Id of the promotion to get current epoch for

returns._0: Current epoch id of the promotion

params._promotionId: Id of the promotion to get settings for
Id of the promotion to get the total amount of tokens left to be rewarded for

returns._0: Amount of tokens left to be rewarded

getRewardsAmount(address,uint256,uint8[].details: Rewards amount can only be retrieved for epochs that are over.Will revert if `_epochId` is over the total number of epochs or if epoch is not over.Will return 0 if the user average balance of tickets is 0.Will be 0 if user has already claimed rewards for the epoch.

params._epochIds: Epoch ids to get reward amount for
params._promotionId: Id of the promotion from which the epoch is
params._user: Address of the user to get amount of rewards for

returns._0: Amount of tokens per epoch to be rewarded

_claimedEpochs.details: _claimedEpochs[promotionId][user] => claimedEpochsWe pack epochs claimed by a user into a uint256. So we can't store more than 256 epochs.

_latestPromotionId.details: Starts at 0 and is incremented by 1 for each new promotion. So the first promotion will have id 1, the second 2, etc.

devdoc.title: PoolTogether V4 TwabRewards

PromotionCreated(uint256).notice: Emitted when a promotion is created.

PromotionDestroyed(uint256,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when a promotion is destroyed.

PromotionEnded(uint256,address,uint256,u.notice: Emitted when a promotion is ended.

PromotionExtended(uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted when a promotion is extended.

RewardsClaimed(uint256,uint8[],address,u.notice: Emitted when rewards have been claimed.

GRACE_PERIOD().notice: Period during which the promotion owner can't destroy a promotion.

claimRewards(address,uint256,uint8[]).notice: Claim rewards for a given promotion and epoch.

destroyPromotion(uint256,address).notice: Delete an inactive promotion and send promotion tokens back to the creator.

endPromotion(uint256,address).notice: End currently active promotion and send promotion tokens back to the creator.

extendPromotion(uint256,uint8).notice: Extend promotion by adding more epochs.

getCurrentEpochId(uint256).notice: Get the current epoch id of a promotion.

getPromotion(uint256).notice: Get settings for a specific promotion.

getRemainingRewards(uint256).notice: Get the total amount of tokens left to be rewarded.

getRewardsAmount(address,uint256,uint8[].notice: Get amount of tokens to be rewarded for a given epoch.

ticket().notice: Prize pool ticket for which the promotions are created.

userdoc.notice: Contract to distribute rewards to depositors in a pool. This contract supports the creation of several promotions that can run simultaneously. In order to calculate user rewards, we use the TWAB (Time-Weighted Average Balance) from the Ticket contract. This way, users simply need to hold their tickets to be eligible to claim rewards. Rewards are calculated based on the average amount of tickets they hold during the epoch duration.
